intro: Angolluma ogadensis, commonly known as the Somali sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various insects and small animals. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
